channel.title: Help Changing Sprite Colors
channel.description:
So please do not say, "use the search button," because I studied at least ten different threads on this topic for several hours and couldn't figure out the problem.
I want to change the color of a wielded item to the color of purple dye (Where do I find the color codes? I could only find hexadecimal codes online).
I did manage to change the color of a dagger to the color of a rune weapon, but I do not know how to generate new colors.

item.description:
@cleako wrote:

You are a funny guy.

Read full topic

i just gave you a function to input the RGB values of a color and return the overlay for the specific color. Also, a function to revert the long into its RGB values

Read full topic

item.title: Help Changing Sprite Colors
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:9, topic:417087”][code=java] public static int convertRGBToLong(int red, int green, int blue) {
return (red << 16) + (green << 8) + blue;
}

public static int[] convertLongToRGB(long longg) { 
	return new int[] { (int) ((longg >> 16) & 255), (int) ((longg >> 8) & 255), (int) (longg & 255)};
}[/code][/quote]

What is this for? Sorry, I don’t understand where you were going with this.

So file by file…

In itemdef, I edit the picturemask.

In items.rscd, I edit the picturemask.

In itemwieldabledef I edit ???

1256 51 16 4 0 85 85 2 3 0 false
In animations, I edit the charcolor (do I need to make a new one?) [code] glowindarkdagger 12255487 0 true false 0 [/code] Which file needs to match this new entry I made and how do I make it do such?

Thanks

Read full topic

@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“A Gh0st, post:10, topic:417087”]None of this is helpful at all. Be specific or don’t post.[/quote]All of the posts have been helpful. If you’re too stupid to understand them then that’s your problem.

item.title: Help Changing Sprite Colors
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[code=java] public static int convertRGBToLong(int red, int green, int blue) {
return (red << 16) + (green << 8) + blue;
}

public static int[] convertLongToRGB(long longg) { 
	return new int[] { (int) ((longg >> 16) & 255), (int) ((longg >> 8) & 255), (int) (longg & 255)};
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help Changing Sprite Colors
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

So all I have to do is change the picture mask and boom, the wielded item should be a different color… Why is this not working for me?

Read full topic

item.title: Help Changing Sprite Colors
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

The picture mask is for the equipped item. The sprites for equipped items are separate as they are monochrome and exist for all 6 angles that the sprite appears as when wielded. The inventory sprite is that you see that remains the same even when you drop the item is a single, static sprite. It does not change and what you see is what you get. Think of it as just a imaginative version with more detail than the wielded item. Try not to think of it as a 3D mesh with different view points yet existing as the same object.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Changing Sprite Colors
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:5, topic:417087”][quote author=A Gh0st link=topic=519026.msg3772638#msg3772638 date=1317837845]
How do you change the color of the actual sprite though? Like the animation sprite. You go to animations.rscd… I need to make a new one for this weapon but what do I do after that? I need to make the dagger correspond somehow… Soooo stinking confusing…
[/quote]You don’t ever change the color of the sprite itself; you change the mask.[/quote]
Doesn’t changing the mask only change how it looks in the inventory?

<AnimationDef> <name>boots</name> <charColour>16777164</charColour> <genderModel>0</genderModel> <hasA>true</hasA> <hasF>false</hasF> <number>0</number> </AnimationDef>

If I wanted to make these boots appear purple when I wore them… How would I do it?

<ItemDef> <name>Iron Short Sword</name> <description>A razor sharp sword</description> <command></command> <sprite>1</sprite> <basePrice>91</basePrice> <stackable>false</stackable> <wieldable>true</wieldable> <pictureMask>15654365</pictureMask> </ItemDef>

Read full topic
